title: Oligarchs and taxes and bonds, oh my!
itunes:title: Oligarchs and taxes and bonds, oh my!
itunes:author: Marketplace / Kai Ryssdal and Kimberly Adams
description:
Today we’re answering questions that get at those knock-on economic effects of Russia’s war with Ukraine we’ve been talking about recently on the show. One listener wonders about gas tax revenue. Another wants to know: What is an oligarch, and why should I care? We’ll tell you that, plus dig into some specifics about the bond market and provide clarification about Fed chief Jay Powell’s magic keyboard.

If you’ve got a question you want us to answer next time, send a voice memo or give us a call at 508-82-SMART (508-827-6278).

Here’s everything we talked about on the show today:

  • “Democrats weigh gas tax holiday to ease inflation pressure on Americans” from NBC News
  • “Whitmer joins coalition of governors calling to suspend federal gas tax” from WZZM
  • Stocks Surge, Oil Falls, Extending Volatility Amid Ukraine War from The Wall Street Journal
  • Scott Tong’s reporting on Venezuela for Marketplace
  • “The U.S. Shifts Focus to Venezuelan Oil, but Output Is Low” from The Wall Street Journal
  • “U.S. ties easing of Venezuela sanctions to direct oil supply” from Reuters
  • “Meet Russia’s oligarchs, a group of men who won’t be toppling Putin anytime soon” from The Conversation
  • “What is a Russian oligarch? Here’s what to know as the U.S. rolls out sanctions” from CBS News
  • “Turning the Focus on America’s Oligarchs” from The New Yorker

Give today to support Make Me Smart.
